data.title: List of Zoroastrians
data.text:
This is a list of Zoroastrians with a Wikipedia article.

Cyrus the Great, (Old Persian: ğ¤ğ¢ğ½ğ¢ğ KÅ«ruÅ¡; Kourosh; New Persian: Ú©ÙˆØ±ÙˆØ´ KuruÅ¡; Hebrew: ×›×•×¨×©, Modern: KÅrÃ©Å¡, Tiberian: KÅrÃ©Å¡; c. 600â€“530 BC) : commonly known as Cyrus the Great, and also called Cyrus the Elder by the Greeks, was the founder of the Achaemenid Empire, the first Persian Empire. Under his rule, the empire embraced all the previous civilized states of the ancient Near East, expanded vastly and eventually conquered most of Western Asia and much of Central Asia

Farhang Mehr, (1923-2018): former Deputy Prime Minister of Iran

Jamshid Bahman Jamshidian, (1851â€“1933): pioneer of modern banking in Iran

Keikhosrow Shahrokh, (1864â€“1929): proponent of the Iranian civil calendar and designer of the Ferdowsi mausoleum

The Cake "Parsee" (colloquial British spelling of Parsi) in "How the Rhinoceros Got His Skin", a chapter in Rudyard Kipling's Just So Stories. Kipling names him as Pestonjee Bomonjee in the illustration accompanying the story.[3]
